This is a student project created at the Higher Institute of Applied Arts in Egypt as part of a graphic design course.
The ad concept focuses on leadership, confidence, and creating your own path in life.
With the tagline “Adidas doesn’t follow the path – Adidas creates the path,” the design reflects Adidas’s core values of innovation, individuality, and forward momentum.

The image features a powerful runner forging a glowing path under the moonlight — symbolizing strength, determination, and originality.
This is a conceptual work and was not commissioned by Adidas. It was created for educational purposes only.

Design by: Haya Emad Battal

This season the sportswear brands went back to the past to make trends in the present, the iconic uniforms that dressed and marked the history of world football… Yes! The history of Men's Football.

But what about Women's Football and its history? Are they also left out of today's brand tributes?

Adidas introducing The Women's Retro Jersey, to honor, celebrate and show the world the long history of the struggle of Women's Football. We travel back to 1895 for 2024 to remember a unique, special and never seen before jersey design… The jersey design of the first ever Women's Football Team: The British Ladies Football Club.

This long-standing collaboration is one of Adidas' most enduring partnerships, reflecting years of shared innovation and commitment.

FARM Rio and Adidas unveil their latest collaborative capsule collection with a campaign that celebrates a decade of creativity and partnership between both brands. In the 10-year commemorative collection, tropical Brazil merges with the world’s most iconic three stripes, showcasing a variety of creations that reflect the essence of both brands. A major highlight is the return of Adidas Originals, which was part of the first collaboration launch in 2014 and is now back with 20 standout pieces, including the classic Firebird jacket, reinvented with new prints. in addition to clothing, the collection features a sportswear line with various accessories such as a backpack, cap, and an “altinha” ball. Moreover, a complementary capsule of classic FARM Rio silhouettes will launch alongside the collaboration. 

The captivating campaign video was directed by Gabriel Novis, who is represented for commercial production in the states by LOS FILMS. It features real athletes dressed in vivid prints, floating above a sand platform tethered to a hot air balloon. As they play "altinha," a beloved Brazilian beach game centered on keeping the ball aloft together, they embody the spirit of collaboration that has defined FARM Rio and Adidas' partnership for the past 10 years. Created without the use of AI, and with the help of expert skydivers who specialize in ballooning, the campaign creates a breathtaking scene that perfectly captures the energy of both brands. Additional beach scenes feature models who embody the joy and freedom of the game, enhancing the campaign’s lively spirit.

"We are incredibly proud of the long-term-partnership with FARM Rio and the unique journey we have been on together. From vibrant streetwear in Originals, refreshing the Adidas sportswear and training offer, connecting FARM Rio’s nature inspired prints with our outdoor products, distinctive swimwear for beaches and pools across the globe, to leveraging the shared love for football in collaboration with the iconic Clube de Regatas do Flamengo. It’s an absolute privilege to work with such a talented, kind, open-minded, and experienced team for 10 years. The exchange of expertise enables us to create best-in class products for the consumer who likes to dress in happiness while
maintaining an active lifestyle,” said Tim Smeets, Senior Product Manager at Adidas.

“The partnership between Adidas and FARM Rio has endured for so long because it is a true fusion of creative forces that complement each other in extraordinary ways. While Adidas brings urban dynamism and innovative fabric technology, FARM Rio adds vibrant colors and lush tropical prints. Together, Adidas and FARM Rio created a perfect balance between street attitude and contagious joy, reflecting a powerful synergy that has captivated and inspired for a long time. It has been fascinating to see how this partnership has grown over the past 10 years and how we've been able to innovate in the design of the pieces,” said Daniela Moritz, Head Designer at FARM Rio.

This collaboration is one of Adidas' longest-running partnerships, alongside other big names including Stella McCartney and Yohji Yamamoto.The Adidas x FARM Rio collection will launch online at farmrio.com and at selected stores this month with prices ranging from $35 to $130 and will be available to purchase in 70+ countries.For more details and to explore the collection, visit farmrio.com.

The brand war between Puma and Nike is a classic example of competition in the marketplace, both companies have been pushing each other to come up with new and innovative products that appeal to consumers. Nike is killing it with Fashion forward designs for millennials; on the other hand, Puma is having a good time producing some of the best athletic footwear. But currently, in terms of product offerings, Nike has different styles, designs, and technologies that appeal to consumers of various age groups. Its collaboration with various fashion designers, celebrities, and sportspersons has clearly helped them take a huge leap forward compared to the market share of Puma, Adidas, and various other existing brands.

Mo Salah, is one of the best football players in the world, and he is an inspiration to every Egyptian, so Adidas launched back in 2018 a campaign called a 100 million strong to urge fans in Egypt to support Salah in the world cup 2018, later in 2019 Egypt was hosting the African Cup of Nations so we created a digital initiative where we had a foot-ball signed with inspirational words and quotes by the Egyptian fans from all over Egypt to send inspirational words to their icon Mo Salah to motivate him before he plays the African Cup of Nations in 2019

For decades, the Stan Smith sneaker redefined what an athletic shoe can be. But starting in 2021, a recycled, PRIMEGREEN upper and a more eco-friendly construction will lead the new Stan Smith collection to redefine what a sustainable shoe can be. Through more sustainable construction featuring a PRIMEGREEN upper made with 50% recycled content, the Stan Smith Collection brings green icons together like never before.
